info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued January 09 at 4:27PM EST until January 09 at 4:45PM EST by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM EST FOR SOUTHWESTERN MOORE...CENTRAL SCOTLAND...SOUTHEASTERN ANSON AND RICHMOND COUNTIES... At 427 PM EST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 12 miles south of Biscoe to 6 miles south of Cheraw State Park, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Rockingham, Pinehurst, Hamlet, Hoffman, Pinebluff, Ellerbe, Foxfire, Dobbins Heights, Taylortown, and Gibson. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EST for central North Carolina. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 900 PM EST for central North Carolina. Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. Straight line winds can blow down trees, power lines, and damage mobile homes and other buildings. Seek shelter in a sturdy structure until the storm has passed. Stay away from windows as flying debris generated by damaging winds can be deadly.
